 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָלַל‎</span>] **verb** ==lift up, cast up== (Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סִלְסֵל‎</span> ***esteem highly***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סִלְסוּל‎</span> ***loftiness, distinction***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוּלָּם‎</span> ladder; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוּלְּמָא‎</span> ***id.***; [[BDB#MI|MI]]<sup>26</sup> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מסלת‎</span> ***highway***; Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סלמת‎</span> ***stair (?)*** [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>329</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***sellu***</u></abbr>, ***sillu***, perhaps ***breast-works*** [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 501</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***draw out, forth*** [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1395</sup> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁלַל‎</span>, but <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ladder (a loan-word according to [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>ZMG liii (1899), 197</sup>), compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֻלָּם‎</span>; see also <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***‰rry***</u></abbr>, ***siege-wall***, Egyptian loan-word from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹלְלָה‎</span> according to [[BDB#WMM|WMM]]<sup>As.u.Eur.101</sup>); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיָּסֹ֫לּוּ‎</span> [[Job.19.12|Job 19:12]]; [[Job.30.12|Job 30:12]] ***Imperative*** masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹ֫לּוּ‎</span> [[Isa.57.14|Isa 57:14]] + 4 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָלּוּהָ‎</span> [[Jer.50.26|Jer 50:26]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֶ֫לָה‎</span>); ***Passive participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְלוּלָה‎</span> [[Jer.18.15|Jer 18:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְלֻלָה‎</span> [[Prov.15.19|Prov 15:19]] — 

**1.** ***cast up a highway:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְסִלָּה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ס‎</span> [[Isa.62.10|Isa 62:10]] (twice in verse), without object [[Isa.57.14|Isa 57:14]] (twice in verse), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֶּרֶךְ לֹא סְלוּלָה‎</span> [[Jer.18.15|Jer 18:15]] figurative of path of upright [[Prov.15.19|Prov 15:19]]. 

**2.** ***cast up a way:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֶּרֶךְ‎</span> with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> ***against***, [[Job.19.12|Job 19:12]] (of besieger, in figure), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ארה‎</span> [[Job.30.12|Job 30:12]] (of besetting foe); Babylonian as a heap of garbage [[Jer.50.26|Jer 50:26]]. 

**3.** ***lift up*** (a song) [[Ps.68.5|Ps 68:5]], with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> person (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁיר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זמּר‎</span>; most as 

**1.**). **Pilpel** ***Imperative*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סַלְסְלֶהָ‎</span> [[Prov.4.8|Prov 4:8]] ***exalt her*** (i.e. Wisdom), i.e. (compare Toy) ***esteem highly, prize.*** **Hithpa\`el** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְתּוֺלֵל‎</span> [[Exod.9.17|Exod 9:17]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) ***exalt oneself***, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> ***against*** (denominative from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סֹלְלָה‎</span> according to [[BDB#Gerber|Gerber]]<sup>52</sup>); compare [[Eccl.39.24|Eccl 39:24]]; [[Eccl.40.28|Eccl 40:28]].
